communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera (audio and video) footage from June 1, 2023 to December 31, 2023, where individuals were charged with resisting arrest, shoplifting, or offenses involving serious physical harm, such as - but not limited to - aggravated assault, homicide, or the use of a firearm.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Body Cam Review

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Body Camera Footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide body camera footage from all arresting officers: 

Incident Involving Sean M. Shaw (May 5, 2016)
Details: Traffic stop in Voorhees, NJ, for an expired registration. Interaction escalated into a physical altercation where Sean M. Shaw allegedly resisted arrest and assaulted officers.
Charges: Obstruction, two counts of aggravated assault on a police officer, resisting arrest, and criminal mischief.

Incident Involving Arthur Barclay (June 7, 2018)
Details: Former State Assemblyman Arthur Barclay was involved in a domestic dispute in Camden’s Fairview section and was charged with simple assault.

Fatal Accident Following Attempted Motor Vehicle Stop (February 6, 2021)
Details: Officers attempted to stop Rashad M. Muse, who fled the scene and was fatally struck by civilian vehicles after exiting his vehicle and running onto I-676.

Incident Involving Weapon Discharge by Officer (April 24, 2023)
Details: A man allegedly assaulted a police officer during an incident where the officer’s weapon discharged, striking the suspect. Incident occurred in Camden County.

Camden Public Protest Incident (August 28, 2020)
Details: An incident during a public protest in Camden where multiple individuals were charged with resisting arrest following a confrontation with law enforcement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Body Cam Review

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Reno 2023 arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to body camera footage from incidents recorded by Reno Police Department officers. Below are the details of the cases I am seeking:

1.	Case #230000007:
Date: 2023-01-01
Report Type: Aggravated Assault
Location: 4500 MIRA LOMA DR #336, Reno

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Body Cam Review

title: CBP Puerto Rico Guidelines (United States Customs and Border Protection)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that United States Customs and Border Protection personnel stationed in the Ramey Sector, which covers Puerto Rico and the surrounding waters, habitually come into contact with undocumented migrants who attempt to reach Puerto Rico by boat: https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/local-media-release/us-border-patrol-apprehends-39-non-citizens-dominican-republic-haiti

Therefore, I request the following documents:

1) Guidelines and rules for CBP personnel when they come into contact with undocumented migrants attempting to reach Puerto Rico through the ocean.

2) Graphs, charts, and statistics concerning apprehensions and detentions of undocumented migrants in and around Puerto Rico.

This request is for all records produced from January 1, 2020 to the time this request is processed. Please send documents to me on a rolling basis.

Documents produced from this request will be used in the course of reporting for Heavy Weather, an independent newsletter about Puerto Rico: heavyweather.ghost.io. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: CBP Puerto Rico Guidelines (United States Customs And Border Protection Ramey Sector)

communications.communication:

Reports show that United States Customs and Border Protection personnel stationed in the Ramey Sector, which covers Puerto Rico and the surrounding waters, habitually come into contact with undocumented migrants who attempt to reach Puerto Rico by boat: https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/local-media-release/us-border-patrol-apprehends-39-non-citizens-dominican-republic-haiti

This request is for all records produced from January 1, 2020 to the time this request is processed. Please send documents to me on a rolling basis.

Documents produced from this request will be used in the course of reporting for Heavy Weather, an independent newsletter about Puerto Rico: heavyweather.ghost.io. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco
